title: How to increase my reading speed from 80 wpm to 300 wpm - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a great disparity as to what reading speeds can be achieved if you do your research on the Internet. However, if you are accurately starting at 80wpm, you should be able to reach your goal, regardless of the scales you find in your research. How do you read faster? Don’t physically move your lips when you read (the concept is called sub-vocalization) as if you were sounding out the words. This is one of the biggest steps in slowing down your reading. While some experts will tell you that some sub-vocalization is a good thing, do not move your lips while reading.When you read something - read it and move to the next word. Moving back to re-read a word is called regression and is another of the big slow-downs in reading.Reading is all about letter and word recognition, so the more vocabulary you know, the easier it will be to recognize the words as you read them. The faster you recognize the word, the more your speed will increase.As others who have answered have also encouraged, READ! There is no substitute to reading - it exposes you to new words, new phrases and gives you more practice in recognizing them. The more quickly you recognize the word, its meaning and how it affects the document (article, email, story or book) that you are reading, the faster you will become. Look on the Internet for free tools to help you read: there a lots to choose from. Overcome the first two items above and then increase your vocabulary (add a word or two in your field or simply from a dictionary every day) and you will get faster! Go for it! Read the correct way and you will get better, continuing to sub-vocalize and regress and, no matter how much you read, you will still not be as fast as you could.

Are you reading for fun or to memorize? If you are reading for fun, there are tricks that can speed up your reading skills significantly. Start by reading words in groups, then in sentences, then in paragraphs. Develop the skills to do this over time - around 3 months if you push yourself.You should not be reading every word on the page. Your brain will fill in the articles and prepositions.Push yourself by doing timed reading activities. It will make you learn to read faster under stress and you can apply the same technique to general reading.There are also speeding reading websites that can assist you on the web if you are interested. But I recommend just reading WikiHow: How to Learn Speed Reading

Reading speed depends on several factors. The reading speed can be increased by following steps. State of Mind. If you are feeling fresh, you will read at better speed.Reading Frequency. The speed of reading increases as you read more and more. I started from 200 wpm and now have reached around 320 wpm in a year without any effort. The average non-native reader is usually at 200wpm.Vocabulary. The new words slow the speed of reading. If an individual improves his vocabulary, he/she can understand the message quickly. It will help him to increase the speed of reading.Comfort Zone. Increase your comfort level while reading. It will increase the speed automatically.

300 words per minute may be a bit of a stretch depending on what you’re reading and the language used. Going from 80 to 300… Hrm… Learn to read sentences, not words. Bearing in mind you need to blink…? Read at your own pace, get used to reading, work out how words piece together and just read, read, read and read!
